title: Gach Sar
text:
Gach Sar (, also <a href="Romanize">Romanize</a>d as Gach-i-Sar and Getschesar) is a village in <a href="Nesa%20Rural%20District">Nesa Rural District</a>, <a href="Asara%20District">Asara District</a>, <a href="Karaj%20County">Karaj County</a>, <a href="Alborz%20Province">Alborz Province</a>, <a href="Iran">Iran</a>. At the 2006 census, its population was 133, in 35 families. Located on the main road from <a href="Tehran">Tehran</a> to <a href="Chalus%2C%20Iran">Chalus</a> on the <a href="Caspian%20Sea">Caspian</a> coast, 7 km south of the <a href="Kandavan%20Tunnel">Kandavan Tunnel</a>, Gach Sar has farmlands irrigated by the <a href="Karaj%20River">Karaj River</a>, producing <a href="fruit">fruit</a>s, as well as plants for animal <a href="fodder">fodder</a>.
Gach Sar has a <a href="gypsum">gypsum</a> mine, and a hotel built during the reign of <a href="Reza%20Shah%20Pahlavi">Reza Shah Pahlavi</a> as a royal lodge. The <a href="Qajar%20dynasty">Qajar</a>-era monarch <a href="Naser%20al-Din%20Shah">Naser al-Din Shah</a> vacationed here twice.
Wildlife.
Naturally occurring local plants include <a href="marjoram">marjoram</a>, <a href="Bugloss%20%28disambiguation%29">bugloss</a>, and <a href="Althaea%20officinalis">marshmallows</a>. Wild animals include <a href="jackal">jackal</a>s, <a href="wolf">wolves</a>, <a href="fox">fox</a>es, <a href="boar">boar</a>s, and <a href="bear">bear</a>s.
